intro: Gypsophila bazorganica, commonly known as the Persian Baby's Breath, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in floral arrangements due to its fluffy appearance and long-lasting blooms. Gypsophila bazorganica is also valued for its ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
